text:
Amalia Ivanovna was totally to blame for the no-shows, so Katerina Ivanovna started treating her with a chill vibe, which Amalia picked up on and didn’t like. Not a great start for the gathering. Eventually, everyone settled in.

Raskolnikov showed up just as they got back from the cemetery. Katerina was super happy to see him. He was the only “smart” guest around and was set to be a professor in two years. Plus, he apologized for missing the funeral, which made her even more excited. She practically dragged him to sit on her left side (Amalia was on her right). 

Even with her constant worry about the food being served right and her bad cough getting worse, Katerina leaned in to whisper her frustrations to Raskolnikov. She was venting about the dinner disaster and couldn’t help but laugh at her guests, especially at her landlady.

“It’s all that cuckoo’s fault! You know who I mean? Her!” Katerina pointed at the landlady. “Look at her, she’s acting clueless, like she knows we’re talking about her. Pfoo, the owl! Ha-ha! (Cough-cough-cough.) And what’s with that cap she wears? (Cough-cough-cough.) Have you noticed that she…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna expresses her frustrations about the dinner and her guests while eagerly engaging Raskolnikov in conversation.
